label: 灌仏会
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A Buddhist ceremony (hōe) held annually on the 8th day of the 4th lunar month, as this was the birthday of The Buddha. On this day scented water or sweet tea was poured over a standing statue of Shaka while prayers were offered in his name. [法会、釈迦]
